ns8:data.ns8:text: Stow, John, 1525?-1605. | Survey of the cities of london and westminster: containing the original, antiquity, increase, modern estate and government of those cities

ns8:datafield.ns8:subfield: Survey of the cities of london and westminster: containing the original, antiquity, increase, modern estate and government of those cities
Survey of the cities of london and westminister
Survey of the cities of london and westminster ... written at first in the year mdxcviii

Survey of the cities of london and westminster containing the original, antiquity, increase, modern estate and government of those cities. written at first in the year 1598. by john stow. corrected, improved, and very much enlarged by john strype. illustrated with exact maps of the city and suburbs, and of all the wards and likewise of the out-parishes of london and westminster: together with draughts of the more eminent and publick edifices and monuments. to which is prefixed, the life of the author, writ by the editor. at the end is added, an appendix of certain tracts, discourses and remarks, concerning the state of the city of london. together with a perambulation or circuit-walk four or five miles round about london, to the parish churches: describing the monuments of the dead there interred: with other antiquities observable in those places

Survey of the cities of london and westminster containing the original, antiquity, increase, modern estate and government of those cities. written at first in the year mdxcviii. by john stow, citizen and native of london. ... now lastly, corrected, improved, and very much enlarged: ... by john strype ... in six books

Survey of the cities of london and westminster containing the original, antiquity, increase, modern estate and government of those cities. written at first in the year mdxcviii. by john stow, citizen and native of london. since reprinted and augmented by a.m.h.d. and other. now lastly, corrected, improved, and very much enlarged: and the survey and history brought down from the year 1633, (being near fourscore years since it was last printed) to the present time; by john strype, m.a. a native also of the said city. illustrated with exact maps of the city and suburbs, and of all the wards; and likewise of the out-parishes of london and westminster: together with many other fair draughts of the more eminent and publick edifices and monuments. in six books. to which is prefixed, the life of the author, writ by the editor. at the end is added, an appendiz of certain tracts, discourses and remarks, concerning the state of the city of london. together with a perambulation, or circuit-walk four or five miles round about london, to the parish churches: describing the monuments of the dead there interred: with other antiquities observable in those places. and concluding with a second appendix, as a supply and review: and a large index of the whole work
Survey of the cities of london and westminster corrected and brought down to the present time

ns9:data.ns9:text: אליעזר בן יואל, הלוי, 1140-1225. | ספר ראבי״ה; כולל פסקי דינים, חדושים ושאלות ותשובות לכל הש״ס

ns9:datafield.ns9:subfield: ספר ראבי״ה; כולל פסקי דינים, חדושים ושאלות ותשובות לכל הש״ס
Sefer RABIYaH, kolel piske dinim, ḥidushim u-sheelot u-teshuvot le-khol ha-SHaS
Sefer Rabiyah : ... pisḳe dinim, ḥidushim u-sheʼelot u-teshuvot le-khol ha-Shas
Sefer Rabiyah : hu avi ha-ʻezri le-masekhtot Ḥulin, Zevaḥim, Menaḥot
Sefer Rabiyah : kolel piske dinim ḥidushim ve-sheʼalot u-teshuvot le-kol ha-Shas

Sefer Rʼabiyah : hu Avi ha-ʻEzri, le-mesekhtot ḥulin, zevaḥim, minḥot ... le-Rabenu Eliʻezer ben Yoʼel ha-Levi. - yṿ"l la-rʼishonah ʻap"y ketav-yad Bet ha-Din de-London ve-r"y aḥerim ʻim hagahot ṿe-marʼe meḳomot
ספר ראבי"ה : הוא אבי העזרי, למסכתות חולין, זבחים, מנחות <הלכות ס"ת, מזוזה, תפלין וציצית> והלכות אזהרת כהנים, בכורות ונשיאת כפים
ספר ראבי״ה : ... פסקי דינים, חידושים ושאלות ותשובות לכל הש״ס
ספר ראבי״ה : הוא אבי העזרי למסכתות חולין, זבחים, מנחות
ספר ראבי״ה : הוא אבי העזרי, למסכתות חולין, זבחים, מנחות ... לרבינו אליעזר בן יואל הלוי. ־ יו״ל לראשונה עפ״י כתב־יד בית הדין דלונדון ור״י אחרים עם הגהות ומראי מקומות
ספר ראבי״ה : הוא אבי העזרי, תשובות ובאורי סוגיות בענינים שונים
‏ספר ראבי״ה :‏ ‏כולל פסקי דינים, חידושים ושאלות ותשובות לכל הש״ס /‏

ns10:data.ns10:text: Wilson, Thomas, 1663-1755. | Knowledge and practice of christianity made easy to the meanest capacities, or, an essay towards an instruction for the indians which will likewise be of use to all such who are called christians, but have not well considered the meaning of the religion they profess, or, who profess to know god, but in works do deny him : in twenty dialogues : together with directions and prayers for the heathen world ... for sundays, &c

ns10:datafield.ns10:subfield: Knowledge and practice of christianity made easy to the meanest capacities, or, an essay towards an instruction for the indians which will likewise be of use to all such who are called christians, but have not well considered the meaning of the religion they profess, or, who profess to know god, but in works do deny him : in twenty dialogues : together with directions and prayers for the heathen world ... for sundays, &c

Knowledge and practice of Christianity made easy to the meanest capacities, or, An essay towards an instruction for the Indians : which will likewise be of use to all such men who are called Christians but have not well considered the meaning of the religion they profess : or who profess to know God, but in works do deny Him : in twenty dialogues : together with directions and prayers, for the heathen world, missionaries, catechumens, private persons, families, of parents for their children, for Sundays, &c

Knowledge and practice of Christianity made easy to the meanest capacities, or, An essay towards an instruction for the Indians : which will likewise be of use to all such who are called Christians but have not well considered the meaning of the religion they profess, or who profess to know God, but in works do deny him : in twenty dialogues, together with directions and prayers, for the heathen world, missionaries, catechumens, private persons, families, of parents for their children, for Sundays, &c

Knowledge and practice of christianity made easy to the meanest capacities : or an essay towards an instruction for the indians : in twenty dialogues, together with directions and prayers for the heathen world
Knowledge and practice of christianity made easy to the meanest capacities : or, an essay towards an instruction for the indians ; ... in several short and plain dialogues

Knowledge and practice of christianity made easy to the meanest capacities or, an essay towards an instruction for the indians; ... together with directions and prayers ... the fourth edition ... by the right reverend father in god, thomas, lord bishop of sodor and man

Knowledge and practice of christianity made easy to the meanest capacities or, an essay towards an instruction for the indians; ... together with directions and prayers ... the second edition, with additions; and corrected throughout. by the right reverend father in god, thomas, lord bishop of sodor and man

Knowledge and practice of christianity made easy to the meanest capacities or, an essay towards an instruction for the indians; ... together with directions and prayers ... the third edition ... by the right reverend father in god, thomas, lord bishop of sodor and man

Knowledge and practice of christianity made easy to the meanest capacities or, an essay towards an instruction for the indians; which will be of use to such christians, as have not well considered the meaning of the religion they profess; or, who profess to know god, but in works do deny him. in several short and plain dialogues. together with directions and prayers for the heathen world, missionaries, catechumens, private persons, families, of parents for their children, for sundays, &c. the second edition, with additions; and corrected throughout. by the right reverend father in god, thomas, lord bishop of sodor and man

Knowledge and practice of christianity made easy to the meanest capacities or, an essay towards an instruction for the indians; which will be of use to such christians, as have not well considered the meaning of the religion they profess; or, who profess to know god, but in works do deny him. in several short and plain dialogues. together with directions and prayers for the heathen world, missionaries, catechumens, private persons, families, of parents for their children, for sundays, &c. the third edition, with the addition of the true method of keeping the lord's day holy; and the lord bishop of london's letter to his clergy, &c. by the right reverend father in god, thomas, lord bishop of sodor and man

Knowledge and practice of christianity made easy to the meanest capacities or, an essay towards an instruction for the indians; which will be of use to such christians, as have not well considered the meaning of the religion they profess; or, who profess to know god, but in works do deny him. in several short and plain dialogues. together with directions and prayers for the heathen world, missionaries, catechumens, private persons, families. of parents for their children, for sundays, &c. the fourth edition, with large additions, and corrected throughout. by the right reverend father in god, thomas, lord bishop of sodor and man
